main.name: Mathijs Hubrechtsen
main.description: An ambitious DIY tinkerer with an entrepreneurial spirit
main.bio: I am a passionate computer science student with aspirations to build my own business some day. To me, technology can be used to create a better tomorrow and I want to show people exactly how. My fields of interest include IoT/embedded devices, cyber security and how technology can be used to improve people's lives.
main.contactmessage: Want to get in touch with me?

education.degree: Bachelor of Science - BS, Computer Science, Cum Laude
education.description: Minor in Business Economics. Also known as “Bachelor in de Informatica”. During this time I also volunteered as a PAL Tutor.

work.title: Software Security Research Assistant (Student)
work.description: During an extended partnership with KULeuven, I worked on various Penetration Testing assignments in Embedded Systems. These included investigating the applications of Software Fuzzing in Automotive Systems, expanding KULeuven's Vehicular Software Security Research in general and exploring Security solutions for Experimental V2X systems.

work.title: CleanTech Board Member
work.description: In this position, I was the AFD Leuven board member responsible for organizing Leuven's CleanTech challenge. The CleanTech challenge is an entrepreneurship competition combined with a workshop track which aims to provide students an opportunity to gain hands-on experience with social entrepreneurship in the technology sector.

work.title: Software Developer (Student)
work.description: Student Job where I worked on building a Python Django Back-End for a new Soundtalks product's Web Application.

work.title: PAL-Tutor
work.description: Peer-Assisted-Learning tutoring service for first year Computer Science students. We provided free tutoring for first year classes and projects.

projects.title: Zoo Network
projects.category: A DIY home lab and computer network, originally built by recycling old computer equipment.

projects.title: Malibu Point
projects.category: Malibu Point is a smart home infrastructure which makes use of (amongst others) Home Assistant, Google Home and various custom components.

projects.title: G.I.N.G.E.R.
projects.category: G.I.N.G.E.R. is a polymorphic Node.js IoT framework, it's intended as both a rapid prototyping framework as well as a framework that can be used in automation contexts.

projects.title: Caring Caribou
projects.category: A friendly car security exploration tool

projects.title: zooWeb
projects.category: A personal web infrastructure which runs a variety of custom sites. Also includes a portfolio website.

projects.title: Zoo Museum
projects.category: The Zoo Museum is a wiki dedicated to Hub Industries and my various endeavors.

projects.title: Publication
projects.category: Co-authored academic publication on software fuzzing in automotive systems.

projects.title: Stream
projects.category: I stream Science & Technology content on twitch.

projects.title: CSx2
projects.category: A way to parse the html calendar of KUL Computer Science to ical format so that it can be added to external calendar applications.

projects.title: ID3-Automator
projects.category: Program that automatically adds meta data to mp3 files in the current directory given a wikipedia album link.

projects.title: DRAMA Stapel Tekenaar
projects.category: Generates DRAMA Stack Frames given DRAMA Assignment Tables.

2 time Winner of Ulyssis CTF Best Bachelor Team
